intro: Sinapis cheiranthos proles recurvata, commonly known as the curlydock, is a herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its rosette of broad, wavy, and often hairy leaves that form a compact cluster near the ground. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a raceme, which are typical of the mustard family. Its seeds are small and capsule-like, containing several tiny seeds that are dispersed by wind. Sinapis cheiranthos proles recurvata is commonly found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, showcasing its adaptability to various environments.
